param.description: Options array. Currently only the 'usedAttributes' option is supported,

docblock.param: which is an array of attributes to add to the AST nodes. Possible attributes are: 'comments', 'startLine', 'endLine', 'startTokenPos', 'endTokenPos', 'startFilePos', 'endFilePos'. The option defaults to the first three. For more info see getNextToken() docs.

comment.value: map from internal tokens to PhpParser tokens
map of tokens to drop while lexing (the map is only used for isset lookup,
that's why the value is simply set to 1; the value is never actually used.)
the usedAttributes member is a map of the used attribute names to a dummy

description.compact: Initializes the lexer for lexing the provided source code.

throws.description: on lexing errors (unterminated comment or unexpected character)

comment.value: keep the code around for __halt_compiler() handling
PHP cuts error message after null byte, so need special case

docblock.description:
The available attributes are determined by the 'usedAttributes' option, which can be specified in the constructor. The following attributes are supported:
* 'comments' => Array of PhpParser\Comment or PhpParser\Comment\Doc instances, representing all comments that occurred between the previous non-discarded token and the current one. * 'startLine' => Line in which the node starts. * 'endLine' => Line in which the node ends. * 'startTokenPos' => Offset into the token array of the first token in the node. * 'endTokenPos' => Offset into the token array of the last token in the node. * 'startFilePos' => Offset into the code string of the first character that is part of the node. * 'endFilePos' => Offset into the code string of the last character that is part of the node

param.description: Variable to store token content in
Variable to store start attributes in
Variable to store end attributes in

description.compact: Returns the token array for current code.

docblock.description: The token array is in the same format as provided by the token_get_all() function and does not discard tokens (i.e. whitespace and comments are included). The token position attributes are against this token array.

return.description: Array of tokens in token_get_all() format

description.compact: Handles __halt_compiler() by returning the text after it.

comment.value: ensure that it is followed by ();
this simplifies the situation, by not allowing any comments
prevent the lexer from returning any further tokens

docblock.description: The token map maps the PHP internal token identifiers to the identifiers used by the Parser. Additionally it maps T_OPEN_TAG_WITH_ECHO to T_ECHO and T_CLOSE_TAG to ';'.

comment.value: 256 is the minimum possible token number, as everything below
HHVM uses a special token for numbers that overflow to double
HHVM also has a separate token for the __COMPILER_HALT_OFFSET__ constant
